contents.content: Just by looking up at the night sky, you can probably tell that stars are not all the same color. Some stars and galaxies emit a lot of blue light, while others emit a lot of red light. Likewise, there are objects in space that emit large amounts of infrared or ultraviolet light.

Astronomers can use these different wavelengths of light to learn about cosmic objects. In the next section of the investigation, you will explore a few ways that light is used to explore the Universe:

  • How infrared light is used to see into dusty nebulae and find dim red stars
  • How infrared light is used to locate very distant galaxies
  • How red light is used to locate the star-forming regions in a galaxy
  • How blue light is used to locate hot, young stars
